website_summaries.verdict: Outdoor lovers view the Merrell Chameleon 7 Waterproof as a comfortable shoe that doesn’t take long to break in. The footgear’s lightweight construction and cushioning properties also received plus points from those who bought it. On the other hand, its restrictive confines and substandard quality are the reasons why consumers were disappointed. All in all, the Chameleon 7 Waterproof from Merrell has its share of advantages that may prove to be useful for day hiking trips.
pros: The Merrell Chameleon 7 Waterproof is very comfortable, as testified by a lot of users
Numerous wearers agree that it is a lightweight hiker
This low-top hiker provides adequate cushioning on the trail, as testified by a couple of outdoor enthusiasts
A handful of buyers say that this Merrell product virtually has no break-in period
The minority appreciates the arch support this hiker offered
cons: Several purchasers are let down by the narrow fit of this hiking shoe
Some adventurers point out the sole’s lack of grip on wet or slippery surfaces
A good number of online reviewers are disappointed with the ineffectiveness of this gear’s waterproof liner

customer_reviews.title: Holds water in, not out. Wears out like a cheap pre-warn out shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Nike tennis shoes that I wore for work for 2 years, after I casually wore them for 2 years before them. Those worn out, $45 Nike's are in better shape than these shoes are after less than 6 months of wear. The waterproof abilities of these shoes has more to do with water not escaping after they have filled up through the already splitting seams. These are by far the worst shoes I've ever purchased, and certainly will not buy another pair of Merrell's again.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Phillips

customer_reviews.title: run a little small

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: With 18 years continuous work within the retail grocery world I can personally attest to comfortably, functionaliy yet professional within the given industry Merrel always performs a notch above the rest. Having years spent $20 a pair for knockoffs to only replace 3 months later, I invest in a pair of Merrell's & get an average of 2 years wear time & is approximately 2000 miles foot to concrete. Comfortable shoe all in all & no need for additional inserts. Vibram sole great, but not slip resistant approved. Solid colors a plus.

product_meta.title: Merrell mens Chameleon 7 Waterproof
product_meta.description: Adapt to whatever Mother Nature throws your way with the versatile style of the Merrell® Chameleon 7 Waterproof hiking shoe! Nubuck, suede leather and mesh upper. Waterproof M Select™ DRY impermeable membrane seals out water and lets moisture escape for drier, more comfortable foot environment. Bellows tongue keeps debris out. Traditional lace-up system with metal hook and lacing eyelet design for a secure fit. Protective rubber toe cap Breathable mesh lining. Kinetic Fit™ Base removable contoured insole for flexible support. Molded TPU heel counter provides added stability. Merrell Air Cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability. EVA midsole for stability and shock absorption. Lightweight FlexPlate™ technology provides torsional rigidity tuned to end use Vibram® TC5+ outsole with 3mm lug depth for excellent traction. Flex Index Grade: 2 Imported. Measurements: Weight: 1 lb 3 oz Product measurements were taken using size 12, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
feature_bullets: Kinetic Fit Base removable contoured insole for flexible support
